definition: to join in the fun/to get in on the action/(fig.) to butt in/to create more trouble
to gather together, pool or collect/to happen by chance/to move close to/to exploit an opportunity
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
variant of 鬧|闹[nao4]
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke

sentences.english: Mr Dedalus said. I was only vamping, man.
sentences.chinese: 迪达勒斯先生说，“伙计，我不过是凑凑热闹。”

sentences.english: Let's hurry and join the fun now.
sentences.chinese: 那我们赶紧去凑凑热闹吧。

sentences.english: Only the foot, and the rest of the medical students pressed in to see.
sentences.chinese: 只有脚还在，余下的学生们也全挤过来凑热闹。

sentences.english: Here is the Beastie Boys performing "Make Some Noise."
sentences.chinese: 这里是野兽男孩表演“凑热闹。”

sentences.english: Let's go join the fun, too.
However, I don't have anything to invest. How can I be a part of the game?
sentences.chinese: 但是我没有什么东西可以投资，要怎样才能凑热闹呢？

sentences.english: However, I don't have anything to invest, how can I be part of the game?
sentences.chinese: 但是我没有什么东西可以投资，要怎样才能凑热闹呢？

sentences.english: Spring rain like mother-in-law of nature, non-go along for the ride to go to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 雨婆婆也喜欢初春的大自然，非要去地面上凑凑热闹。

definition: to enjoy watching a bustling scene/to go where the crowds are
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
to heckle/rowdy jeering/to create a disturbance
to watch a play/to watch passively (i.e. from the sidelines, from the crowd)
bustling with noise and excitement/lively
to cheer on (originally esp. as paid stooge)/to root for sb/to sing sb's praises/to flatter
to serve as a stopgap/to make up a shortfall in the number of people
to argue noisily/to shout/to make widely known/to reproach
dragged down by having a family to feed
to disturb/to create confusion/to make a din
gongs and drums overture to a Chinese opera/to create a disturbance
to buy soy sauce/it's none of my business ("I’m just here to buy some soy sauce")
(coll.) to cause trouble for sb/to inconvenience
to look for trouble
very far away
to call on sb/to drop in/to visit sb's home
